document_metadata.name: The Spleen Tyrosine Kinase (Syk) Regulates Alzheimer Amyloid-β Production and Tau Hyperphosphorylation*

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: Following 24 h of treatment with the pure enantiomers or the racemic mixture of nilvadipine, a dose-dependent inhibition of Aβ production was observed (Fig. 1A).

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: In addition, a reduction in BACE-1 protein levels was observed following treatment of HEK293 cells with (-)-nilvadipine or racemic nilvadipine (Fig. 1D) further suggesting that the inhibition of Aβ production observed following nilvadipine treatment is mediated in part by a reduction of BACE-1 expression.

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: We tested the effect of an acute treatment with (-)-nilvadipine or (+)-nilvadipine on brain Aβ levels using Tg PS1/APPsw mice, and we observed that both (-)-nilvadipine and (+)-nilvadipine acutely reduced brain Aβ levels with similar potency (Fig. 2, C and D).

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: We have previously shown that racemic nilvadipine affects the β-cleavage of APP and reduces sAPPβ secretion

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: We have previously shown that racemic nilvadipine affects the β-cleavage of APP and reduces sAPPβ secretion

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: We found that, like (-)-nilvadipine, Syk inhibition with the selective Syk inhibitor BAY61-3606 resulted in decreased sAPPβ secretion, BACE-1 mRNA, and BACE-1 protein expression (data not shown).

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: We found that both (-)-nilvadipine and racemic nilvadipine reduce BACE-1 mRNA expression (Fig. 1C) induced by TNFα

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: As (-)-nilvadipine and racemic nilvadipine inhibit BACE-1 transcription, we evaluated whether (-)-nilvadipine was impacting NFkB activation because NFkB has been shown to play an important role in the regulation of BACE-1 transcription and expression (36, 37, 43, 44)

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: We found that, like (-)-nilvadipine, Syk inhibition with the selective Syk inhibitor BAY61-3606 resulted in decreased sAPPβ secretion, BACE-1 mRNA, and BACE-1 protein expression (data not shown).

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: In addition, a reduction in BACE-1 protein levels was observed following treatment of HEK293 cells with (-)-nilvadipine or racemic nilvadipine (Fig. 1D) further suggesting that the inhibition of Aβ production observed following nilvadipine treatment is mediated in part by a reduction of BACE-1 expression.

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: We found that, like (-)-nilvadipine, Syk inhibition with the selective Syk inhibitor BAY61-3606 resulted in decreased sAPPβ secretion, BACE-1 mRNA, and BACE-1 protein expression (data not shown).

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: We found that both the (-)- and (+)-nilvadipine enantiomers enhance Aβ42 clearance from the brain to the peripheral side of the in vitro BBB model (Fig. 2A).

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: Data show that (-)-nilvadipine stimulated the clearance of human Aβ42 across the BBB as more human Aβ42 was detected in the plasma of (-)-nilvadipine-treated mice than control animals (Fig. 2B).

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: We found that both the (-)- and (+)-nilvadipine enantiomers enhance Aβ42 clearance from the brain to the peripheral side of the in vitro BBB model (Fig. 2A).

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: Western blot analyses of brain homogenates show that (-)-nilvadipine significantly reduces Tau phosphorylation in AT8 (phosphorylated Ser-199/Ser-202/Thr-205) and PHF-1 (phosphorylated Ser-396/Ser-404) epitopes (Fig. 3).

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: Western blot analyses of brain homogenates show that (-)-nilvadipine significantly reduces Tau phosphorylation in AT8 (phosphorylated Ser-199/Ser-202/Thr-205) and PHF-1 (phosphorylated Ser-396/Ser-404) epitopes (Fig. 3).

links.evidence: Western blot analyses of brain homogenates show that (-)-nilvadipine significantly reduces Tau phosphorylation in AT8 (phosphorylated Ser-199/Ser-202/Thr-205) and PHF-1 (phosphorylated Ser-396/Ser-404) epitopes (Fig. 3).

links.evidence: Western blot analyses of brain homogenates show that (-)-nilvadipine significantly reduces Tau phosphorylation in AT8 (phosphorylated Ser-199/Ser-202/Thr-205) and PHF-1 (phosphorylated Ser-396/Ser-404) epitopes (Fig. 3).

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: In particular, we monitored RAF phosphorylation following treatment with (-)-nilvadipine and observed that (-)-nilvadipine prevents RAF phosphorylation induced by PMA (Fig. 4, C and D) suggesting that (-)-nilvadipine is impacting a target upstream of RAF

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: Using a cell-free assay using human recombinant Syk, we observed that (-)-nilvadipine dose-dependently inhibits Syk activity (Fig. 5A)

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: To ensure that the reduction in Syk activity observed was not due to an interaction of the peptide substrate with (-)-nilvadipine, we also verified that (-)-nilvadipine was able to directly bind to Syk.

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: We measured the binding affinity of (-)-nilvadipine for Syk using biolayer interferometry and confirmed that (-)-nilvadipine binds to human recombinant Syk with a binding dissociation constant (KD) of 2.1 µM (Fig. 5C), further suggesting that Syk is the possible target impacted by nilvadipine.

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: The magnitude of the NFkB inhibition following (-)-nilvadipine treatment was also reduced in clones of HEK293 NFkB luciferase reporter cells in which Syk expression had been silenced (data not shown) further suggesting that Syk is required to mediate the inhibition of NFkB activity induced by (-)-nilvadipine.

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: Tumor necrosis factor-α (TNFα) has been shown to induce BACE-1 expression and to contribute to brain accumulation of Aβ peptides

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: We observed that (-)-nilvadipine inhibits NFkB activation in response to TNFα (Fig. 4A) or phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate (PMA) (Fig. 4B) by using an NFkB-luciferase reporter cell line to monitor NFkB activation, thus suggesting a possible mechanism responsible for the inhibition of BACE-1 transcription following nilvadipine treatment

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: We observed that (-)-nilvadipine inhibits NFkB activation in response to TNFα (Fig. 4A) or phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate (PMA) (Fig. 4B) by using an NFkB-luciferase reporter cell line to monitor NFkB activation, thus suggesting a possible mechanism responsible for the inhibition of BACE-1 transcription following nilvadipine treatment

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: PMA is a known agonist of PKC, which leads to the activation of the PKC/RAS/RAF/MEK/MAPK pathway that ultimately induces NFkB activation (46–48)

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: PMA is a known agonist of PKC, which leads to the activation of the PKC/RAS/RAF/MEK/MAPK pathway that ultimately induces NFkB activation (46–48)

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: As expected, RAF phosphorylation induced by PMA as well as basal RAF phosphorylation were reduced in 7W CHO cells transfected with SYK shRNA confirming a reduction in Syk activity (Fig. 6B).

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: Tyrosine kinases, including Syk and Bruton’s tyrosine kinase (BTK), are activated following PMA treatment (49, 50), act upstream of RAS/RAF (51, 52), and mediate the activation of the NFkB pathway (53).

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: In addition, we verified that pharmacological inhibition of Syk with BAY61-3606 resulted in a blockade of NFkB activation and that genetic down-regulation of SYK using shRNA also prevented NFkB activation (data not shown) thus highlighting Syk as a key player of NFkB activation.

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: The magnitude of the NFkB inhibition following (-)-nilvadipine treatment was also reduced in clones of HEK293 NFkB luciferase reporter cells in which Syk expression had been silenced (data not shown) further suggesting that Syk is required to mediate the inhibition of NFkB activity induced by (-)-nilvadipine.

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: We found that Syk inhibition with the selective Syk inhibitor BAY61-3606 suppresses Aβ production in 7W CHO cells overexpressing APP (Fig. 6A).

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: Interestingly, Aβ production in 7W CHO cells transfected with SYK shRNA compared with 7W CHO cells (Fig. 6C) was significantly reduced, further demonstrating the involvement of Syk in the regulation of Aβ production.

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: We show that the selective Syk inhibitor BAY61-3606 stimulates the transport of Aβ across the BBB in vitro mimicking the biological activity of (-)-nilvadipine in this model (Fig. 7A).

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: We found that, like (-)-nilvadipine, Syk inhibition with the selective Syk inhibitor BAY61-3606 resulted in decreased sAPPβ secretion, BACE-1 mRNA, and BACE-1 protein expression (data not shown).

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: As expected, RAF phosphorylation induced by PMA as well as basal RAF phosphorylation were reduced in 7W CHO cells transfected with SYK shRNA confirming a reduction in Syk activity (Fig. 6B).

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: Syk has been shown to mediate the phosphorylation of Tau at Tyr-18 (56).

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: We observed that pharmacological inhibition of Syk with BAY61-3606 stimulates Ser-9 phosphorylation of GSK3β in SH-SY5Y cells (Fig. 9,Aand B) suggesting that blocking Syk activity results in GSK3β inhibition.

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: PKA is a known substrate of Syk, and it has been shown that Syk inhibits PKA activity by phosphorylating Tyr-330 of the PKA catalytic subunit (60), further supporting our observation.

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: We found that Syk inhibition with BAY61-3606 induced CREB phosphorylation, although that event is inhibited in the presence of a selective PKA inhibitor (Fig. 10, A and B) further showing that Syk inhibition results in PKA activation.

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: PKA is a known substrate of Syk, and it has been shown that Syk inhibits PKA activity by phosphorylating Tyr-330 of the PKA catalytic subunit (60), further supporting our observation.

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: Tyrosine kinases, including Syk and Bruton’s tyrosine kinase (BTK), are activated following PMA treatment (49, 50), act upstream of RAS/RAF (51, 52), and mediate the activation of the NFkB pathway (53).

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: We tested a selective BTK inhibitor (BTK inhibitor III, 1-(3-(4-amino-3-(4-phenyloxy phenyl)-1H-pyrazolo[3,4-d]pyrimidin-1-yl)piperidin-1-yl)prop-2-en-1-one, N-acryloyl-(3-(4-amino-3-(4-phenyloxyphenyl)- 1H-pyrazolo[3,4-d]pyrimidin-1-yl)piperidine) on Aβ production, and we found that this compound was unable to significantly inhibit Aβ production (data not shown) suggesting that the Aβ-lowering properties of nilvadipine are not mediated via an inhibition of BTK.

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: We tested a selective BTK inhibitor (BTK inhibitor III, 1-(3-(4-amino-3-(4-phenyloxy phenyl)-1H-pyrazolo[3,4-d]pyrimidin-1-yl)piperidin-1-yl)prop-2-en-1-one, N-acryloyl-(3-(4-amino-3-(4-phenyloxyphenyl)- 1H-pyrazolo[3,4-d]pyrimidin-1-yl)piperidine) on Aβ production, and we found that this compound was unable to significantly inhibit Aβ production (data not shown) suggesting that the Aβ-lowering properties of nilvadipine are not mediated via an inhibition of BTK.

links.evidence: The Syk inhibitor BAY61-3606 was used as a positive control in the Syk activity assay, and a dose-dependent inhibition of Syk activity was observed with BAY61-3606 as expected (Fig. 5B).

links.evidence: In addition, we found that BAY61-3606 stimulates the clearance of Aβ across the BBB in wild-type mice as demonstrated by increased circulating plasma levels of human Aβ42 in mice treated with the Syk inhibitor compared with vehicle-treated mice following the intracranial injection of human Aβ42 (Fig. 7B)

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: We observed a reduction in Tau phosphorylation at the Tyr-18 epitope as expected (Fig. 8) in BAY61-3606-treated mice.

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: Interestingly, we also detected a reduction in Tau phosphorylation at PHF-1 (Ser(P)- 396/Ser(P)-404) and CP13 (Ser(P)-202) in epitopes following treatment of Tg Tau P301S mice with BAY61-3606, whereas the RZ3 (Thr(P)-231) Tau epitope was not significantly impacted (Fig. 8) suggesting that Syk inhibition may also control the activity of other downstream kinases involved in Tau hyperphosphorylation

links.evidence: We found that KT5270 effectively suppressed GSK3β phosphorylation at Ser-9 induced by BAY61-3606 (Fig. 10B) suggesting that this event is mediated by an activation of PKA.

links.evidence: GSK3β phosphorylation at Ser-9 has been shown to be mediated by PKA and AKT (protein kinase B) (57, 58).

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: We found that KT5270 effectively suppressed GSK3β phosphorylation at Ser-9 induced by BAY61-3606 (Fig. 10B) suggesting that this event is mediated by an activation of PKA.

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: We found that Syk inhibition with BAY61-3606 induced CREB phosphorylation, although that event is inhibited in the presence of a selective PKA inhibitor (Fig. 10, A and B) further showing that Syk inhibition results in PKA activation.

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: GSK3β phosphorylation at Ser-9 has been shown to be mediated by PKA and AKT (protein kinase B) (57, 58).

citation.db_name: The spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) regulates Alzheimer amyloid-β production and Tau hyperphosphorylation.

links.evidence: PKA is a known substrate of Syk, and it has been shown that Syk inhibits PKA activity by phosphorylating Tyr-330 of the PKA catalytic subunit (60), further supporting our observation.
